WRITING.TEXT:
Ah thank you ever so much for the explanation! That was perfect.
So do you recommend the 50/50 build? (Presuming that is TF/GB/IE/Shiv/Lucid holds then eventually ER after selling boots)
Or would full crit generally be better after the slight lethality nerfs?
Apologies for all the questions!

WRITING.TITLE: How does Lethality work, and is it still required after LW buff?
WRITING.TEXT:
Hello GPmains!
I am a relatively new GP player. I have sandboxed the combos a little bit and have played a few normals and I have finally found a champion that I have a blast (no pun intended) to play!
My question:
How is lethality calculated in game and after the LW buff, is it needed?
I ask this because I see that LW now gives 45% armour penetration. The tooltip of our barrels reads 40%, making 85% together.
Since this is a high number, do we really need lethality or can we run the 100% crit build instead?
I may be very wrong with them stacking as it does sound completely broken but I thought I'd ask anyway!
Thank you in advance 3
-Caeliah, EUW

I love match days!
All that excitement and prediction of score lines
The anticipation of the starting line up and formation
The strong start showing lots of promise
Ending up as complete disappointment to balance things out.
Still, they'll always have my support! UTV VTID

Brilliant starting line up. That would be, in my opinion, one of our strongest line ups we could put out.
The team has to start performing together now, so we can finish on a high note.
/u/hiyakatie ted?!

Thanks bro but currently I have absolutely nothing connected to the PC whatsoever other than the Mobo, CPU and heatsink. It's just either an endless 2 second pre BIOS bootloop or it's a black screen with the fans endlessly running. Can't really be the ram. There's no beeps whatsoever either
Thanks for the reply :) new update, instead of a bootloop the fans now start up infinitely with a black screen and no bios. It just spins infinitely with nothing happening. Just the fans
Also tested the ram I need to add. I've literally disconnected everything from the PC other than the CPU, heatsink and Mobo and the same occurs every single time.

WRITING.TITLE: Need help Reddit, weeks of frustration.
WRITING.TEXT:
Hello /r/pcmasterrace.
I have been frustrated for weeks now. My PC I build years ago cost 1500 to make. It's lasted me 3 years without a single issue, till now.
I was stuck in a 3 second bootloop. I would turn the PC on, nothing posted. Didn't get to BIOS, it would literally start the fans, turn off automatically and restart itself endlessly.
I replaced both the PSU and Mobo together, I am still having identical pre BIOS bootloops where nothing happens, I assume my CPU has gone (lol cy@ I7 4970k).
I have bought and sent back several motherboards due to wrong specs in the last few days and the one that fit my CPU was a 1150 socket. As I've put it in my rig and tested it, I can no longer send it back. So I need to ask you all:
Which processor can I use for gaming? I want a decent processor as I'm used to the high end I7 however I only really play games such as World of Warcraft, League of Legends and BF1. I don't want to break the bank on this.
Does anyone know of an all round good performing Intel processor that is compatible with a Gigabyte GA-Z97P-D3 socket 1150 motherboard?
I feel like giving up right now
Thanks in advance if anyone can help me.
Thanks bro. I usually double scoop my protein every shake (35g per scoop) so two of them a day and I've hit my protein in take regardless, can then focus on calories then!

Not necessarily what's wrong with it in general, but for me. I'm very light for my height so I would assume eating heavily fatty take out foods every day would make me hit calorie surplus quickly but neglect my body in other nutrients it would need.
Just going to stick to carbs for quick release energy, high protein with some fats. I've read a few links some Redditors have kindly sent me and I'm seeing generic trends on how to diet to build up so I have a rough guide. It's all starting with eating more regardless!

Thanks for the swift reply! It's much appreciated
So because I'm on the very light side I can generally eat "clean" (not binging on high fat meals), keep my calories high with plenty of protein and generally not have to worry?

Seen conflicting information about calorie intake.
I'm currently 5"11' and weigh 69kg so I'm very much what most people would call skinny fat. I've got a workout I very much find fun and I do notice slight improvement in the weight I'm lifting, but I just can't put body weight on
I've always been told that calorie surplus is needed for muscle mass gain however I've also been told that eating in surplus will make my gains unnoticeable as I'll put fat on too...how should I be bulking? Thanks ^^

That diet is everything.
I was drastically underweight due to an eating disorder and struggled to put on the weight due to lack of eating but then wondered where my gains were.
Recently started a high protein/carb diet with high calorie shakes in between in an attempt to bulk and genuinely feel much better.
Although I'd currently be described as "skinny fat" now I've always been told you need to eat in surplus to gain muscle mass so I can always cut after!
Not as graceful as Giroud but it works!

Judge Rinder.
I do not think I could emotionally, physically or mentally endure the tutting and head shaking in disapproval I would receive.

Hello there!
A little bit of context, I play many sports and hit the gym, I've worn glasses for the majority of my life and contact lenses didn't aid my dry eye whatsoever. I had -4.7 in my right eye, -4.75 in my left with slight astigmatism.
I was consulted by 3 surgeries in the UK to have the surgery done and the last one persuaded me to proceed due to how amazingly comfortable the surgeon made me feel.
Fast forward 4 weeks and I had my procedure and I have to be honest, given the chance to go back and do it again, I would with ZERO hesitation.
My eyesight is now one step better than 20/20, I had very limited side effects and my life has completely changed for the better.
If you PM me I'd be more than happy to go through the procedure, after care and recovery process with you.
Peace!
Sounds simple, but breadsticks. Was at New Years party and drinking an amount of alcohol that George Best would have been proud of. Saw the bread sticks, them troopers saved my skin that night.

Currently using "YASH2". It differs from other difficulty modifiers as it actually changes everything rather than randomly buffing/debugging things
Be warned though. It makes it Dark Souls level difficult, it is very, very rewarding though.

I decided to play a completely magic only play through and so far I have strictly used only Destruction, Restoration and Illusion.
I have found some mods that drastically change the difficulty of the game on PS4 so I may do stealth archer in the future on a new play through as a much higher difficulty might offset the fact of how OP it is.
I love magic but I am a little let down at how weak magic is as opposed to archery and melee but I think there's mods to help with that too!
The way of the Mage is the only way for me
Leicester are taking their lessons against Man City seriously. Sadly they are defensive lessons.
Aha thanks for pointing out but as you can see the Diana didn't work out. Loving the new main! Onwards and upwards

Does everyone have to be so toxic? Just say "nice man, good job". He's clearly proud of it. No need to be complete ass hats, let's see you put more clips of yourselves on here for others to see if you think you can do better.
Nice one dude, Azir sent back to the fountain in style!
Funny watching these insane hooks for me to play Thresh and get serenaded with "lol auto filled support" when I feed constantly
